required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Targeted Inpatient Navigation to Improve Care for Minority Children and Families
clinical_study.official_title: Targeted Inpatient Navigation to Improve Care for Minority Children and Families

brief_summary.textblock:
The overall goal of this research is to evaluate a new program designed to address basic human needs, create a safe and supportive environment for families, and help families build skills and confidence for navigating the health care system.
Specifically, we aim to pilot test the feasibility and acceptability of the Targeted Inpatient Navigation (TNav) program for families of low income, minority hospitalized children.

primary_outcome.description: Program acceptability will be determined qualitatively, on the basis of thematic content analysis of semi-structured interviews with enrolled caregivers

primary_outcome.time_frame: Calculated for each family after program involvement is complete, generally 1 week after discharge.
primary_outcome.description: Ability to deliver program elements as planned, calculated as the number of Family Bridge services delivered to a family divided by the services available to that family.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Once per month, every month that they care for an enrolled family, up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Program acceptability will be determined qualitatively, on the basis of thematic content analysis of semi-structured interviews with the doctors, nurses, social workers and care coordinators who were involved in their hospital care.

secondary_outcome.description: 4 items measuring perceived similarity or difference in norms and values between family and medical providers. Each of the 4 items is scored on a Likert scale from 1 to 6, with higher values reflecting greater difference. The total scale score is the average of the 4 responses, on a scale from 1 to 6.
20 items measuring perceived barriers to medical care.
10-item tool measuring understanding of and ability to interact with health professionals and organizations.

4 items, scored from 0 (Never) to 4 (Very Often), related to perceived stress and control over one's life. Responses are summed for a total score from 0 to 16, with higher scores reflecting greater stress.
9 items assessing familiarity with navigating the local health care system.
9 items assessing quality of communication from doctors and nurses, including at discharge.

secondary_outcome.measure: US Census question followed by preferred language for care
secondary_outcome.description: 2-item, sequential approach with excellent sensitivity and specificity for needing interpretation for medical care.
1 item assessing need for assistance with medical forms.
10 items assessing quality of transition and comfort and understanding of home care.
7 items to determine whether family's needs were identified and met during hospitalization

arm_group.description: Families receive Family Bridge Program services which include orientation to the hospital, concrete needs assessment, communication preferences assessment, communication coaching, follow-up during the hospital stay, and a follow-up phone call after discharge.

intervention.description: Families receive Family Bridge Program services which include orientation to the hospital, concrete needs assessment, communication preferences assessment, communication coaching, follow-up during the hospital stay, and a follow-up phone call after discharge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Caregiver ≥18 years of age, with a hospitalized child <18 years old
- Preferred language of English, Spanish and Somali
- child with Medicaid insurance or no insurance
- child with self-reported (or parent-reported) minority race/ethnicity
- within 3 days of admission/ transfer to the medical unit on a general medicine service of a resident team
Exclusion Criteria:
- Admission for suspected child abuse
- Involvement of Child Protective Services at time of admission
- Admission for primary mental health condition, including intentional ingestion and eating disorder
- Family already enrolled in longer-term navigation services

responsible_party.investigator_title: Investigator | Center for Child Health, Behavior and Development
